summary: This document is an email chain from July 2019 discussing media inquiries and legal complaints regarding Nicholas Tartaglione, Jeffrey Epstein's cell mate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). It involves an Assistant U.S. Attorney, defense attorney Bruce Barket, and journalist Tracy Connor, and centers on allegations of leaked false information about Tartaglione being questioned regarding a possible attack on Epstein.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney representing Nicholas Tartaglione; forwards a journalist's inquiry to a U.S. Attorney, alleging false information about his client was leaked in retaliation for complaints about prison conditions.

persons.name: Tracy Connor
persons.context: Journalist from The Daily Beast attempting to confirm an NBC News story about Nicholas Tartaglione being questioned regarding a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The high-profile inmate at the MCC; the media inquiry concerns a possible attack on him, allegedly involving his cell mate.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Client of Bruce Barket and cell mate of Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC; alleged to have been questioned about a possible attack on Epstein, which his attorney claims is false information leaked in retaliation.

connections.description: Bruce Barket is the defense attorney representing inmate Nicholas Tartaglione, as indicated in his email signature and his advocacy against leaked information.
Tartaglione is identified as Epstein's cell mate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), which is the basis for him being questioned about a possible attack.
Barket corresponds with an Assistant U.S. Attorney (recipient of the forwarded email) regarding the alleged leak of false information about his client.
Journalist Tracy Connor sends an inquiry to attorney Bruce Barket seeking confirmation of an NBC story about his client, Tartaglione.

events.title: Media Inquiry About Possible Epstein Attack
events.description: Tracy Connor of The Daily Beast emails Bruce Barket attempting to confirm an NBC News story that his client, Nicholas Tartaglione, was questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC.

events.title: Attorney Complaint About Leaked Information
events.description: Bruce Barket forwards the media inquiry to a U.S. Attorney, alleging that false information about his client Tartaglione was leaked by someone in the facility, seemingly in retaliation for complaints made to the court about conditions.

events.title: AUSA Dismisses Allegation as Preposterous
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney responds to the forwarded chain, calling the situation 'preposterous' and noting Tartaglione was questioned simply because he was Epstein's cell mate, referencing a Daily Beast article where Barket made his complaint.

keyFacts: Nicholas Tartaglione was Jeffrey Epstein's cell mate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in July 2019.

An NBC News story reported Tartaglione was questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein, a claim his attorney Bruce Barket alleges is false information leaked in retaliation for complaints about prison conditions.
Bruce Barket, Tartaglione's attorney, suggests the leak came from someone within the detention facility following complaints made to the court.
An Assistant U.S. Attorney dismissed the concern, stating Tartaglione was questioned simply because he was Epstein's cell mate and referencing Barket's own public comments in The Daily Beast.
